intro: Aparine, commonly known as betony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white, typically arranged in whorls along the stems. Aparine is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it thrives in moist, shady environments. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported soothing and healing properties.
